instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Board was water damage and has bios issue ,reprogram the bios and everything working ok ,just no wifi .Bluetooth working ,just no wifi I mean doesnt see wifi card at all ,not talking about signal

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Known good IO board and cable?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Dont have to test another one ,I have wifi card from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> can try it or just will not work

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: It's not the card of course. Get a known good IO board and flat cable. I believe the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> card may work for testing, will only work in OSX not in the boot menu.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: tried new cable ,board, card still missing <SIGNAL>WIFI_EVENT</SIGNAL>

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>WIFI_EVENT</SIGNAL> is supposed to be low.
Inpsect J4410 for corrosion and do diode mode test on all <SIGNAL>PCIE_AP</SIGNAL> lines.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Fixed it was <CHIP>U4450</CHIP> never check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN</SIGNAL> line was missing
